text: Good news, google or approved img selects that Justin wanted to feature in our case study write up. There's some overlap with our video footage and overall direction which means I'm feeling safer than ever about our video. Full steam ahead!
nice!
i’d like to touch base at some point today on some of the specific shots in the current edit. if only because i have some thoughts
small things, but worth discussing
This looks excellent so far team! One quick question, did we decide to stray away from showing a short clip of someone actually tapping on the box with their finger and interacting with it?
the only reason I ask is b/c to an outside person I am wondering if they would get a sense of the fact that it's an interactive wall as much without that visual context
Very artistic and emotive. Also like the music.

Thinking ahead: If we ever want to do color correction again, this is totally worth investing in. It’s the grandaddy of color effects & corrections in AE: <http://www.redgiant.com/products/magic-bullet-looks/>

attachments.title: Red Giant | Magic Bullet Looks

text: my grandfather was a racist alcoholic - is that what I can expect from this software?
LOL
Thats the upgraded model
the trump of models
Sorry. Did anyone see my question above: did we decide to stray away from showing a short clip of someone actually tapping on the screen with their finger and interacting with it?
From my understanding we are still selecting specific shots. Current cut reflects story arc & presentation. Individual cuts can be swapped out for better ones.
The problem we found is that when the user went to press on the button, the activation spot was off center, and it doesnt look so great on camera
(ex: you’d have to press way off the word for “okay” to activate next sequence)
I would like us to look into showing more of the UI/UX as we go forward
but, as stated, this is still a WIP
Oh I see
Thanks :slightly_smiling_face: I was just curious
